contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=April 2008}} {{Korean name|[[Choi (Korean name)|Choe]]}} {{Infobox Korean name |hangul=최세진 |hanja=崔世珍 |rr=Choe Se(-)jin |mr=Ch'oe Sejin }} '''Choe Sejin''' (1473–1542) was a [[Korea]]n [[linguistics|linguist]], [[educator]], and a proponent of [[hangul]] during the [[Joseon Dynasty]]. He is of the [[Goesan]] [[Choe clan]] and [[courtesy name]] was Gongseo (공서; 公瑞).<ref name="EncyKorea">{{cite web|url=http://www.encyber.com/search_w/ctdetail.php?masterno=147691&contentno=147691 |title=최세진 崔世珍|trans_title=Choe Se-jin |publisher= [[Encyclopedia of Korean Culture]] |language=Korean |accessdate=2009-09-18}}</ref> Choe devised the modern South Korean order of the [[hangul]] letters, and assigned names to the letters. His most famous book on hangul is the ''Hunmong Jahoe'' ({{lang|ko|훈몽자회}}; {{lang|ko-Hant|[[wikt:訓|訓]][[wikt:蒙|蒙]][[wikt:字|字]][[wikt:會|會]]}} "Collection of Characters for Training the Unenlightened (= Kids)", 1527). Choe was an official [[Interpreter (communication)|interpreter]] in the Korean [[embassies]] in [[Beijing]], and so he also documented colloquial northern [[Chinese language]]s ([[Haner language|Haner]]). ==See also== * [[List of Korea-related topics]] * [[History of Korea]] * [[Joseon Dynasty]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Choi, Sejin | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1473 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1542 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Choi, Sejin}} [[Category:1473 births]] [[Category:1542 deaths]] [[Category:Joseon Dynasty people]] [[Category:Linguists from Korea]] [[Category:Goesan Choe clan]] {{Korea-linguist-stub}}
